#Tonight the Jordan School Board acted on a resolution to support K–12 #Hybrid Learning for our “Base Learning Model" for Fall 2020. This would also include the option of the Jordan Virtual Academy, our fully online learning alternative for K-12 families.

In this hybrid model, grades K-6 will be on-site in their buildings 5 days a week (learning environments at 50% capacity, following strict social distance recommendations, and other health requirements). Grades 7-12 will follow an ABABC model. Group A will attend on Mon and Wed (distance learning when not on-site), Group B will attend on Tue and Thur (distance learning when not on-site), and C Friday = All students flex learning (may include potential on-site interventions, assessments, labs, large group music as needed). Preschool programming will run at their regular schedule.

It is always important to remember that learning models can change based on shifts in COVID data either within our county, community, or buildings.

Detailed plans will follow in a communication to families within the week.

Jordaness Lions
May 1 at 3:14 PM ·

Unusual times call for unusual measures!

For over ten years, the Jordaness club has been giving Norway Pine trees to Jordan's Kindergarten students. Typically, club members hand out the trees at Jordan Elementary School and St. John the Baptist School. This year, however, club members greeted parents and students as they drove to pick up their trees.

We had lovely weather for the event, and were thrilled with the happy smiles on the students' faces (and the parents', too!)

Who's old enough to remember Chris Norman, lead singer of Smokie? Well, Mr. Dietel is 😉 and he (and his 3rd grade students) got a fun surprise this week courtesy of one of our staff members, Mrs. Love. Mrs. Love shared, "when in school, we often end our day in Mr. Dietel's room with "old" songs he likes. He always teaches the kids the message behind the song, and to watch them sing is priceless. We have continued to sing "Alice Next Door" at our Zoom meetings. Early April I decided to Google the man who recorded Alice in the 70's and learned he still tours in Europe. His management office let me know he doesn't Zoom. I thought that was the end of it until this morning when I received this wonderful recording for Mr. Dietel and class with a special recording of Alice for us." We'd like to extend this special opportunity to all you 70's loving fans as well! Enjoy!

More: Chris Norman is an English soft rock singer. Norman was the lead singer of Smokie, an English soft rock band which found success in Europe in the 1970s. "Stumblin' In", a 1978 duet with Suzi Quatro, was a big US hit.

Once produced, please place in a ziplock bag and drop off at Jordan Middle School (feel free to add a special note to the frontline workers). There will be a box by the front door.

We will deliver to our contact at the hospital. They are excited to receive this helpful gift. With questions: communications@isd717.org

Approved 3D source file: https://3dprint.nih.gov/discover/3dpx-013410

😷 Today we delivered 60 "mask relief straps" to St. Francis Regional Medical Center in Shakopee. These straps were constructed using our Industrial Tech 3D printer. It was our honor to provide this important and often needed PPE. We know that some in our community with personal 3D printers and filament may also be interested in joining our efforts. If so, we'd ask that you follow the link below to the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services – National Institutes of Health approved open source design. This design has been approved by St. Francis.

Once produced, please place in a ziplock bag and drop off at Jordan Middle School (feel free to add a special note to the frontline workers). There will be a box by the front door.

We will deliver to our contact at the hospital. They are excited to receive this helpful gift. With questions: communications@isd717.org

Approved 3D source file: https://3dprint.nih.gov/discover/3dpx-013410

⚠️STARTING TOMORROW! The Hwy 21 bridge replacement project in Jordan begins on Monday, March 16th and will continue through November to replace two bridges and to build a trail for pedestrians and bicyclists.

On Monday, construction crews will close Hwy 21 between Mill St. and south of the Sand Creek bridge to:
📌Replace two bridges over Sand Creek and the Union Pacific railroad
📌Build a trail for pedestrians and bicyclists between Mill St. and the Sand Creek bridge
📌Reconstruct Hwy 21 between Mill St. and south of the Sand Creek bridge

Drivers will be detoured to Sawmill Rd./Old Hwy 169, Hwy 59/Delaware Ave., Hwy 169, Hwy 282 and Hwy 21. Motorists are encouraged to allow for extra time and plan ahead.

📌All traffic impacts are tentative and weather dependent.

For more information, visit the project website at: http://www.dot.state.mn.us/metro/projects/hwy21-282-jordan/index.html?utm_content=&utm_medium=email&utm_name=&utm_source=govdelivery&utm_term=
